author: Staff Reporter
text:
Protest against tax:All jewellery stores were closed in Kosakadai street in Puducherry on Wednesday. -PHOTO: M Samraj

Over 500 jewellery outlets in the city downed their shutters on Wednesday as part of the three-day nation wide strike protesting against levy of one per cent Excise duty announced in the Union budget.

A spokesperson of the Puducherry Jewellery Shop Owners Association said that jewellers were already facing challenges after the Government decision to make PAN card mandatory for purchases above Rs.2 lakh and above.

Customers are also not comfortable with the whole process and the move has affected business severely.

The Union Government should immediately roll back the order on Excise duty.

The closure of jewellery outlets for three days in the city would affect business to the tune of Rs.100 crore, he added.
title: Jewellery outlets down shutters in Puducherry
